channel.title: python on Alexander Lab @ WHOI
channel.description: Recent content in python on Alexander Lab @ WHOI

item.title: Using anvi'o in interactive mode
item.description: Anvi’o is a powerful tool for analyzing and vizualizing ‘omics data, much of which relies on one’s ability to visualize those data. On Poseidon, it can sometimes be difficult to work with these kinds of plotting tools, because we’re working on the command line. To use anvi’o interactively on Poseidon, we need to go through a few extra steps. I’ll walk you through the whole installation of anvi’o here from start to finish!

item.title: Fixing my matplotlib font woes
item.description: Over the last few years I have made a transition in my workflow from doing most of my data exploration and plotting on my local machine (a 2016 MacBook laptop) to doing most of my plotting on a remote HPC (check out this other blog post for more on that). This workflow is very convenient for many reasons (keeping all files in one location, more extensibility and power for my notebooks that my personal laptop can’t handle, minimizing file storage on my local machine, etc.
